intro: Verbesina ancistrophora, commonly known as the woolly goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and bright yellow inflorescences that bloom in the summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, composite flower heads. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
